sentences.english: An exception was Egypt, where receipts shot up by 14%.
sentences.chinese: 埃及一個例外，其進款猛增了14%。

sentences.english: Yet the cameras proliferate, and replace human eyes.
sentences.chinese: 然而，攝像頭數量猛增，而且取代了人眼。

sentences.english: In late 2007, the Chinese government was scrambling to control a capital-spending boom.
sentences.chinese: 2007年末，中國政府正忙於控制資本投入猛增。

sentences.english: Around the same time, bush-meat sales increased in Malabo.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時馬拉博的叢林肉銷售量猛增。

sentences.english: A meal that raises blood sugar fast and furiously can leave you dragging like a willow in a windstorm.
sentences.chinese: 讓你血糖猛增的一餐會使你像暴風中的垂柳一樣。

sentences.english: The needs of personal computers were surging in the first half of the year.
sentences.chinese: 今年上半年，家用電腦的需求量不斷猛增。

sentences.english: As the world’s population continues to boom so does density in major conurbations.
sentences.chinese: 隨着世界人口的激增，大城市的承載力也在猛增。

sentences.english: While oil demand has risen inexorably in China, domestic production has barely increased.
sentences.chinese: 中國石油需求量猛增，而國內生產量幾乎沒有增長。

sentences.english: Prices aren't the only reason behind the surge of customers to UGI and other utilities.
sentences.chinese: 但價格並非UGI和其他公司的顧客猛增的唯一因素。

sentences.english: The circulation of the monthly shot up to almost 500000.
sentences.chinese: 這個月刊的發行額猛增到50萬份。

sentences.english: And we do a lot of page views.
Carsales spiked in this month, but it will return to normal next month.
sentences.chinese: 這個月汽車銷量猛增，但下個月會恢復正常。

definition: (of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
to double/to redouble/to increase many times over/to multiply by a factor/multiplication
